title: List of prime ministers of India - Wikipedia
snippet: Jawaharlal Nehru was India's first prime minister, serving as prime minister of the Dominion of India from 15 August 1947 until 26 January 1950, and thereafter of the Republic of India until his death in May 1964. (India conducted its first post-independence general elections in 1952).

title: List of Prime Ministers of India | Britannica
snippet: [Test your knowledge of India’s prime ministers with this quiz.] ... V.P. Singh (1989–90) ... P.V. Narasimha Rao (1991–96) ... H.D. Deve Gowda (1996–97) Inder K. Gujral (1997–98) ...

title: Prime Ministers of India - Complete List from 1947 to 2025
snippet: Dr. Manmohan Singh was the Prime Minister of India before Narendra Modi, serving from 2004 to 2014.

title: Prime Minister of India - Wikipedia
snippet: Singh resigned as prime minister on 17 May 2014, after Congress' defeat in the 2014 general election. In the general election of 2014, the BJP-led NDA won an absolute majority, winning 336 out of 543 Lok Sabha seats. The BJP became the first party since 1984 to secure a majority in the Lok Sabha. Narendra Modi, then the Chief Minister of Gujarat, was elected prime minister, becoming the first prime minister to have been born in an independent India.

title: Former Prime Ministers | Prime Minister of India
snippet: At 40, Mr. Rajiv Gandhi was the youngest Prime Minister of India, perhaps even one of the youngest elected heads of Government in the world. His mother, Smt. Indira Gandhi, was eight years older when she first became Prime Minister in 1966. His illustrious grandfather, Pt.
